phrases: The latch on the back gate is creaky.
Want me to oil it later?
The mistress would also like you to shorten her stick by an inch.
She is recovered from her cold.
However, she is had no appetite the last few days...
Well, I suppose it does take the elderly a while to recuperate.
Sugar, a pound of tea, a pint of vinegar, and a quart of milk should always be stocked.
Red lentils, broad beans, and shallots...
You are going to be a wonderful wife.
I was asked to give you this.
Will not you try to eat a little?
I am not really that hungry.
But, you should at least try a mouthful...
Did you receive another letter from Young Master Jones?
It is a shame I cannot take a walk in Hyde Park on such a wonderful day.
Once your leg mends, you can go whenever you wish.
The latch on the gate is broken, so he is gone to buy a new one.
It stops so often these days.
For years, I would wind it 1 5 times every morning.
I have to wind it more these days, since I have not been using it.
Shall I take it in to be mended, madam?
Your mistress has hurt her leg?
Even when my father fell into the Thames years ago, he lived through it, hardy as ever.
But when he hurt his leg, it was not long before he died.
You will have to leave this with me.
They would often come here together, when her husband was alive...
I hope she gets well soon.
I will keep trying to convince my father until he understands how serious we are.
PIease, I want you to trust me and wait for me...
Can you inform me when my father returns?
So, Prince Hakim, you think lndian women are the most beautiful, right?
I used to think they were...
English women are all so very beautiful.
But I am afraid I am already spoken for.
You have been sending a lot of letters recently!
But if they are not for Eleanor, then who?
I told you, they are for business.
What kind of person is she?
Come now, have I met her?
Knowing you, she is a Baronet's daughter.
Well, she may be a maid now...
Well, she may be a maid now...
I did not think even you could have so little common sense.
Even a child would know that!
You always think with your heart instead of your brain.
You have no grasp of the situation!
You are hardly one to speak!
Have not you thought about our family's reputation?
I have got things to say!
We have not finished talking yet!
We will continue after I have spoken to father.
You are going to tell father?
I knew what your position would be.
But I am telling you this, regardless.
She is not like other maids.
Her character is not the problem.
A wife has many important duties.
She must organize dinners, balls and tea parties.
She has to converse appropriately, display the correct manners.
She must be educated, and speak the Queen's English.
Can a mere maid accomplish all this?
You told me once yourself, father.
A gentleman is bred, not born.
Through its nature and training, a horse can become a champion.
However, a cat cannot become a horse.
If you insist on going through with this, then you will be banishing yourself from your class.
You have brothers and sisters, Stevens, and over 1 00 servants that you are responsible for.
There is also the history that your predecessors in the family have created.
Have you not considered these things?
Are you prepared to shun your responsibilities to satisfy your own desires?
Is that the kind of man you are?
Do not think that you can graft a reed to an elm tree.
Elms grow on hills, reeds live by the water.
This is the natural order of things.
Freedom and disorder should not be confused.
You might feel better if I wipe you down.
I thought I would gotten better...
And you seemed so happy up until recently...
Young people do have their ups and downs.
Mr. Jones... wrote me to say that he would talk to his father.
He says that he will make his father understand...
The more realistically I think about it...
Are you really going to sleep there?
I will turn the light out.
You should really try and eat a little bit of what you fancy.
Well, nothing to be done about her age...
How about a bit of fruit?
I really do not have an appetite.
Can you tell him to come and see me?
He comes here every day, but he never bothers to climb the stairs to see me.
The mistress would like to speak with you.
No... I was just thinking of planting some roses.
I could order the bushes from a friend of mine.
He owes me a few favors.
We could have afternoon tea when the flowers are in bloom.
What did you want to talk to me about?
I have a favor to ask.
I do not know if I can be of help, but I am all ears.
There is no way they could be happy.
You should not give her false hope.
That is true... everything is so complicated...
But, Emma is in love with him.
She is never felt this way before.
She may never feel this way again...
I sympathize with Mr. Jones, but I want to help them.
The pocket watch has been mended, so I was asked to deliver it here.
Your pocket watch has been fixed...
